alert.note: Alert for Orange; Riverside; San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 6:48AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including coast and valley locations in San Diego County and the southern portion of the Santa Ana mountains in Orange County. * WHEN...Until 930 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water ponding on roads during the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 646 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain. Minor flooding is expected in the advisory area this morning. Between 0.15 and 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chula Vista, Oceanside, Carlsbad, El Cajon, Vista, Encinitas, National City, La Mesa, Escondido, Fallbrook Poway and Imperial Beach. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
